bibl.title: Greek Epic Fragments from the Seventh to the Fifth Centuries B.C.
bibl.note: Introduction. - The Theban Cycle. - The Trojan Cycle. - Poems on Heracles and Theseus. - Genealogical and Antiquarian Epics. - Unplaced Fragments (mostly ascribed to "Homer"). - Comparative Numeration. Index.
bibl.seg: WEST Martin L. (Edited and Translated by), Greek Epic Fragments from the Seventh to the Fifth Centuries B.C. (The Loeb Classical Library. 497.)
Cambridge, Mass. - London, Harvard University Press, 2003, 8Â°, x-316 pp. ISBN 0-674-99605-4. $21.50.

Introduction. - The Theban Cycle. - The Trojan Cycle. - Poems on Heracles and Theseus. - Genealogical and Antiquarian Epics. - Unplaced Fragments (mostly ascribed to "Homer"). - Comparative Numeration. Index.

C.R. par Michael J. Anderson, BMCRev < http://ccat.sas.upenn.edu/bmcr/2004/2004-04-35.html >. - Richard Janko, CR N.S., 54 (2004) pp. 283-286 [concerne aussi: Martin L. WEST (Edited and Translated by), Homeric Hymns. Homeric Apocrypha. Lives of Homer (Cambridge, Mass. - London, 2003)]. - Giampiero Scafoglio, Ordia prima 5 (2006) pp. 190-192. - W.F. Wyatt, NECJ 31 (2004) No. 1, pp. 44-46.
